aiAnalysis.summary: AFJ Limited's staging environment demonstrates strong authentication controls with properly protected admin endpoints returning 403 responses. However, the application has a critical gap in security headers across all tested pages. Four pages are missing essential security headers (X-Content-Type-Options and X-Frame-Options), which protect against MIME-type sniffing and clickjacking attacks respectively. Additionally, recommended headers like Strict-Transport-Security, Content-Security-Policy, and Permissions-Policy are absent across the board, leaving the application vulnerable to various client-side attacks. SSL/TLS is properly configured, and there is no evidence of sensitive data leakage in API responses.
recommendations: Immediately implement X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header on all pages to prevent MIME-type sniffing attacks
Add X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN (or DENY if no framing is needed) to all pages; currently only partially implemented on /admin
Configure Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) header with a minimum max-age of 31536000 seconds to enforce HTTPS-only access
Develop and deploy a Content-Security-Policy (CSP) header to mitigate XSS and injection attacks; start with a restrictive policy and adjust based on application needs
Add Referrer-Policy header (recommend 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin') across all pages for privacy protection
Implement Permissions-Policy header to restrict access to sensitive browser features (camera, microphone, geolocation, etc.)
Apply security headers globally via web server configuration (nginx/Apache) or application middleware rather than page-by-page to ensure consistent coverage
